keyFacts: A federal grand jury subpoena was issued to Experian on August 30, 2019, seeking financial account information and credit reports for Tova A. Noel and Michael A. Thomas.
The subpoena is part of an official criminal investigation of a suspected felony, with the U.S. Attorney's Office requesting confidentiality to prevent interference.
The requested records relate to alleged violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1791 and 201, which concern bribery of public officials and witnesses, and providing contraband in prison.
The document reveals an active grand jury investigation in the Southern District of New York in late summer 2019, focusing on the financial backgrounds of these two individuals.
